label: ham
to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: Debian Alsa
body: A commodity _is_ a use-value, wheat, linen, a diamond, a machine, etc., but as a commodity it is, at the same time, _not_ a use-value. If it were a use-value for its owner, i. e., a direct means for the satisfaction of his own wants, then it would not be a commodity. To him it is rather _a non-use-value_; it is merely the material depository of exchange-value, or simply a _means of exchange_; as an active bearer of exchange value, use-value becomes a means of exchange. To the owner it is a use-value only in so far as it constitutes exchange value.[12]
